skill.name: pytdc
skill.description: Therapeutics Data Commons. AI-ready drug discovery datasets (ADME, toxicity, DTI), benchmarks, scaffold splits, molecular oracles, for therapeutic ML and pharmacological prediction.
skill.summary: Therapeutics Data Commons. AI-ready drug discovery datasets (ADME, toxicity, DTI), benchmarks, scaff...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing reference materials and templates for the PyTDC library. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access, no external commands. Pure prompt-based skill for helping users work with drug discovery datasets.

content.user_title: Access drug discovery datasets for AI
content.value_statement: Working with drug discovery datasets requires navigating scattered sources and inconsistent formats. PyTDC provides 50+ curated therapeutic ML datasets with standardized APIs, meaningful splits, and benchmark evaluation protocols.
actual_capabilities: Load 50+ therapeutic ML datasets (ADME, toxicity, DTI, molecular generation)
Apply scaffold and cold splits for realistic model evaluation
Evaluate predictions with standardized metrics (ROC-AUC, MAE, RMSE)
Use 17+ molecular oracles for property optimization
Run benchmark group evaluations with 5-seed protocol
Convert molecules between SMILES, ECFP, PyG, and DGL formats
limitations: Requires PyTDC library installation (pip install PyTDC)
Does not perform molecular generation itself

use_cases.title: Benchmark ML models
use_cases.description: Evaluate ADMET prediction models on standardized datasets with proper scaffold splits and 5-seed evaluation protocol.

use_cases.title: Access curated datasets
use_cases.description: Download pre-processed therapeutic datasets with drug-target interactions, toxicity labels, and absorption predictions.

use_cases.title: Optimize molecules
use_cases.description: Use molecular oracles (QED, GSK3B, DRD2, SA) to guide generative model training and property optimization.

prompt_templates.title: Load ADME dataset
prompt_templates.scenario: Get started with drug absorption data
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the Caco2_Wang ADME dataset from PyTDC and show me how to apply a scaffold split with seed 42. Print the train, valid, and test sizes.

prompt_templates.title: Evaluate toxicity model
prompt_templates.prompt: Using PyTDC, load the hERG toxicity dataset. Create a scaffold split with 70% train, 10% valid, 20% test. Then show how to evaluate predictions using MAE and ROC-AUC metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Run benchmark group
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to use the ADMET benchmark group in PyTDC to evaluate a model across all 5 required seeds. Include code for computing mean and standard deviation of results.

prompt_templates.title: Generate with oracles
prompt_templates.prompt: Using PyTDC oracles, show me how to evaluate multiple molecules for GSK3B binding, QED drug-likeness, and synthetic accessibility. Include a multi-objective scoring function.

output_examples.input: Load a drug-target interaction dataset for binding affinity prediction
output: - DTI datasets available: BindingDB_Kd, BindingDB_IC50, BindingDB_Ki, DAVIS, KIBA
- Split methods: random, cold_drug, cold_target, cold_drug_target
- Cold splits ensure test drugs/targets are unseen during training
- Data format: Drug_ID, Target_ID, Drug (SMILES), Target (sequence), Y (binding affinity)

best_practices: Use scaffold or cold splits to prevent data leakage in drug discovery tasks
Run evaluations across multiple seeds (1-5) to ensure robust results
Combine multiple oracles for multi-objective molecular optimization
anti_patterns: Using random splits for drug discovery - scaffold/cold splits are more realistic
Evaluating on training data - always use held-out test sets
Ignoring synthetic accessibility (SA) scores when generating novel molecules

faq.question: What datasets are available for ADME prediction?
faq.answer: PyTDC includes 50+ ADME datasets covering Caco2 permeability, HIA, bioavailability, BBB penetration, CYP metabolism, and solubility.

faq.question: Does PyTDC include molecular generation models?
faq.answer: PyTDC provides oracle functions for evaluating generated molecules but does not include generative models. Use with your own models.

faq.question: How do I evaluate my model on multiple datasets?
faq.answer: Use benchmark groups like admet_group() for standardized multi-dataset evaluation with 5-seed protocol and computed statistics.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using PyTDC?
faq.answer: PyTDC only downloads public datasets. Your training data stays local. No data is transmitted to external servers during normal use.

faq.question: Why use scaffold splits instead of random?
faq.answer: Scaffold splits group molecules by chemical structure, ensuring test molecules are structurally distinct from training. More realistic for drug discovery.

faq.question: How does PyTDC compare to other molecular datasets?
faq.answer: PyTDC provides unified APIs, standardized splits, benchmark groups, and oracles. It complements datasets like ChEMBL with ML-ready formats.
